result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher H Belland

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

*NOT ON RECORD*Defendant Christopher H Belland appeared by phone.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
DE will mail request for discovery.  DE doesn't understand, this is a worthless checks case, he said he paid.  State will check into that if he has paid she will dismiss in the mean time the State requested a STC with the judge because of the confusion.

4:10 PM Prosecuting attorney Joan M. Korb in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher H Belland in court. 
Deft advised of rights, received criminal complaint/reading waived.
Charges and penalties read by the Court. Probable cause found in criminal complaint.
Deft wishes to represent himself at this time.
NG plea entered. No bond set.
950/Marsy's Law complied with.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Scheduling conference on October 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 13, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Initial appearance on July 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
